text.__SUMMARY__: The Indian pipistrelle (Pipistrellus coromandra) is a species of bat in the family Vespertilionidae found in Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Cambodia, India, Myanmar, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Thailand, and Vietnam.
text.Description: Head and body length is 8–9 cm. Forearm is 3 cm. Wingspan 19–22 cm. Weight 9-13g.
text.Culture:
Known as ඉන්දු කොස්-ඇට වවුලා  (indu kos aeta wawulaa) in Sinhalese and চামচিকা (chamchika) in Bengali.
